result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael Domini Scott in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Domini Scott is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Domini Scott

All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court, defendant Michael Domini Scott not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court called case upon request from the parties.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Defense requests to be heard on bail ASAP. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 40.

Defendant Michael Domini Scott in court by video with Attorney Paige Aleece Styler who appears in person.  Defendant Michael Domini Scott in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Petersen. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail.
Received and Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Tyrone J.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Michael Domini Scott in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Michael Domini Scott in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Domini Scott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
